comment._content: ancestry dot com suggests Ethel lived until 1978! Not sure where they sourced that.

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content: P appears to be for Pansy.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Could be something in the Births, marriages and Deaths column of the Irish Times, November 23rd 1978 (page 24 or 30).

comment.author: 8468254@N02
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] are you sure? L is for some 4 letter word but neither the word nor the plant looks much like a lily.

Edit: Though according to wikipedia, the only other 4-letter garden plants beginning with L are Leea and Luma, neither of which look remotely like that (being bushes), so I guess it must be Lily.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/8468254@N02] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] It's Lily of the Valley.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Their mother, Augusta Caroline:

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] You're absolutely right! From the Irish Times of Thursday, 23 November 1978:
DILLON November 21, 1978 (peacefully), at Our Lady's Nursing Home, Edgeworthstown, Co. Longford, Hon. Ethel Louisa, in her 99th year. Funeral tomorrow (Friday), arriving at Ahascragh Church at 3 o'c.
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
